news.title: Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelensky arrives at Áras to meet President Catherine Connolly
UK is closing loophole that grants cheap windfalls to Irish pension savers
news.summary: The UK is shutting a lucrative loophole that enabled Irish people who once worked there to cheaply boost their British state pension entitlements by thousands of euro a year.

news.title: Rugby World Cup 2027 draw: A complete guide to Ireland’s dream and nightmare scenarios ahead of Wednesday’s draw
news.summary: The draw for the 2027 Rugby World Cup takes place on Wednesday in Australia, when Ireland and 23 other teams will learn their pool-stage opponents for the biggest tournament yet.

news.title: ‘We are the only country in the world not offering this’ – doctor travelling to Spain to operate on Irish women forced to go abroad for incontinence surgery
news.summary: An Irish doctor is taking the drastic step of travelling to Spain to perform surgery to treat urinary incontinence in female patients of his who cannot get the operation here.

news.title: ‘Mam transferred the farm to me but her health has deteriorated and my siblings won’t help out. Am I liable for her care? What are my options?’
news.summary: Query:  Dear Mary Frances, I don’t know where to turn. Two years ago, I inherited the family farm from my mother, who was in good health at the time.

news.title: Kirsty Blake Knox: I had ‘sequel fatigue’ – until I heard about Macaulay Culkin’s idea for a ‘Home Alone’ reboot
news.summary: In the movie world, barely a week goes by where we do not hear about a prequel, sequel, remake, origin story or secondary character branching out and becoming the main event.

news.title: Having a narcissistic parent – how does it manifest, how will it affect you and what can you do about it?
news.summary: What do fictional characters Miranda Priestly, Villanelle, and Brigid Jones’s mother have in common?

news.title: Moulin Rouge high-kicks the winter blues with a frenzy of glitzy glamour in this Christmas cracker
news.summary: The Bord Gáis Energy Theatre has opted for this showgirl/guy extravaganza as its festive offering and it’s certainly a Christmas cracker. Based on the 2001 Baz Luhrmann film, this high-kicking, fish-netted, head-feathered confection leans into the sexy and seedy side of cabaret but comes out smelling of romance and roses.

news.title: Meet the Leitrim woman who swapped living on Dublin’s O’Connell Street for a 100-year-old farmhouse and a six hour daily commute
news.summary: After eight years of city centre living on O’Connell Street, Martha Gilheaney is now in the middle of making a rural 100-year-old Leitrim farmhouse her home.

news.title: Lucinda O’Sullivan’s restaurant review: Like many things that are overhyped, Gloria Osteria’s ‘incomparable lemon pie’ tastes like styrofoam
news.summary: Every so often a new restaurant lands in our fair city and it’s treated like the arrival of the messiah. Of course I get the invitations to participate, but do I really want a ‘hard hat’ tour of the fit-out?
